00050 integer::integer(const integer& b) {
00051     if (b.is_nan()) data=0;

00099 void integer::_init(detail::digit_t init) {
00100     try {
00101         data=new detail::data_t(init);
00102     } catch (std::bad_alloc&) {
00103         throw xint::overflow_error("Out of memory allocating xint::integer");
00104     }
00105     _attach();
00106 }
00107 
00108 void integer::_init(const integer &c) {
00109     #ifdef XINT_DISABLE_COPY_ON_WRITE
00110         data=(c.data ? new detail::data_t(c.data) : 0);
00111     #else
00112         data=c.data;
00113     #endif
00114     _attach();
00115 }
00116 
00117 void integer::_init(boost::uintmax_t n) {
00118     static int bits=std::numeric_limits<boost::uintmax_t>::digits;
00119     static int maxDigits=(bits+detail::bits_per_digit-1)/detail::bits_per_digit;
00120 
00121     try {
00122         data=new detail::data_t;
00123     } catch (std::bad_alloc&) {
00124         throw xint::overflow_error("Out of memory allocating xint::integer");
00125     }
00126     _attach();
00127 
00128     data->alloc(maxDigits);
00129     for (int x=0; n != 0; ++x) {
00130         data->digits[x]=detail::digit_t(n & detail::digit_mask);
00131         n >>= detail::bits_per_digit;
00132     }
00133     data->skipLeadingZeros();
00134 }
00135 
00136 void integer::_attach() {
00137     if (data) data->attach();
00138 }
00139 
00140 void integer::_detach() {
00141     if (data && data->detach()) delete data;
00142 }
00143 
00144 void integer::_make_unique() {
00145     try {
00146         if (data && data->mCopies > 1) {
00147             detail::data_t *newstore=new detail::data_t(data);
00148             _detach();
00149             data=newstore;
00150             _attach();
00151         }
00152     } catch (std::bad_alloc&) {
00153         throw xint::overflow_error("Out of memory allocating xint::integer");
00154     }
00155 }
00156 
00157 void integer::_set_negative(bool negative) {
00158     if (negative != (sign() < 0)) *this=negate(*this);
00159 }
00160 
00165 bool integer::odd() const {
00166     _throw_if_nan();
00167     return ((_get_digit(0) & 0x01)==1);
00168 }
00169 
00174 bool integer::even() const {
00175     _throw_if_nan();
00176     return ((_get_digit(0) & 0x01)==0);
00177 }
00178 
00184 int integer::sign() const {
00185     _throw_if_nan();
00186     if (data->mIsNegative) return -1;
00187     if (_get_length()==1 && _get_digit(0)==0) return 0;
00188     return 1;
00189 }
00190 
00197 bool integer::is_nan() const {
00198     return (data==0);
00199 }
00200 
00206 size_t integer::hex_digits() const {
00207     _throw_if_nan();
00208     size_t bits=log2(*this);
00209     return (bits+3)/4; // Four bits per hex digit, rounded up
00210 }

00212 integer& integer::operator+=(const integer& addend) {
00213     if ((sign() < 0) == (addend.sign() < 0)
00214         && data->mLength >= addend.data->mLength)
00215     {
00216         // Fast in-place add
00217         _make_unique();
00218         data->add(addend.data);
00219     } else {
00220         // This works for all cases
00221         *this=add(*this, addend);
00222     }
00223     return *this;
00224 }
00225 
00226 integer& integer::operator-=(const integer& subtrahend) {
00227     if (sign() >= 0 && subtrahend.sign() >= 0 && *this >= subtrahend) {
00228         // Fast in-place subtract
00229         _make_unique();
00230         data->subtract(subtrahend.data);
00231     } else {
00232         // This works for all cases
00233         *this=subtract(*this, subtrahend);
00234     }
00235     return *this;
00236 }

00238 integer& integer::operator=(const integer &c) {
00239     _detach();
00240     #ifdef XINT_DISABLE_COPY_ON_WRITE
00241         data=(c.data ? new detail::data_t(c.data) : 0);
00242     #else
00243         data=c.data;
00244     #endif
00245     _attach();
00246     return *this;
00247 }

00249 integer& integer::operator*=(const integer& b) { *this=multiply(*this, b); return *this; }
00250 integer& integer::operator/=(const integer& b) { *this=divide(*this, b); return *this; }
00251 integer& integer::operator%=(const integer& b) { *this=mod(*this, b); return *this; }

00253 integer& integer::operator++() { *this += one(); return *this; }
00254 integer& integer::operator--() { *this -= one(); return *this; }
00255 integer  integer::operator++(int) { integer s=*this; *this += one(); return s; }
00256 integer  integer::operator--(int) { integer s=*this; *this -= one(); return s; }

00258 integer  integer::operator<<(size_t shift) const { return shift_left(*this, shift); }
00259 integer  integer::operator>>(size_t shift) const { return shift_right(*this, shift); }
00260 integer& integer::operator&=(const integer& n) { *this=bitwise_and(*this, n); return *this; }
00261 integer& integer::operator|=(const integer& n) { *this=bitwise_or(*this, n); return *this; }
00262 integer& integer::operator^=(const integer& n) { *this=bitwise_xor(*this, n); return *this; }

00264 integer& integer::operator<<=(size_t shift) {
00265     if (shift>0) {
00266         _make_unique();
00267         data->shift_left(shift);
00268     }
00269     return *this;
00270 }
00271 
00272 integer& integer::operator>>=(size_t shift) {
00273     if (shift>0) {
00274         _make_unique();
00275         data->shift_right(shift);
00276     }
00277     return *this;
00278 }

00280 const integer& integer::zero() {
00281     if (cZero.get()==0) cZero.reset(new integer(0));
00282     return *cZero;
00283 }
00284 
00285 const integer& integer::one() {
00286     if (cOne.get()==0) cOne.reset(new integer(1));
00287     return *cOne;
00288 }

00290 detail::digit_t integer::_get_digit(size_t index) const {
00291     return data->digits[index];
00292 }
00293 
00294 detail::digit_t integer::_get_digit(size_t index, bool) const {
00295     if (index >= data->mLength) return 0;
00296     return data->digits[index];
00297 }

00299 size_t integer::_get_length() const {
00300     return data->mLength;
00301 }

00303 void integer::_throw_if_nan() const {
00304     if (is_nan()) throw not_a_number();
00305 }
